section.title: Part C: Environment & Preferences
section.subtitle: WHERE DO YOU THRIVE? - Your ideal learning environment
section.description: Think about where you learn best and what environment suits you.

questions.text: I am open to studying far from home.
I prefer a vibrant social scene with lots of activities.
Cost is a major factor in my university decision.
I would enjoy living in a big city.
I thrive in competitive academic environments.
I am willing to take on student loans for the right university.
I prefer to stay close to my family and friends.
I learn better in small, intimate class settings.
Scholarships and financial aid are essential for me.
I am excited about experiencing different climates and cultures.
I want a campus with strong community values.
I prioritize universities with good return on investment.
I would prefer a rural or suburban campus setting.
I value diversity in my learning environment.
I need to work part-time while studying.
I am comfortable being far from familiar surroundings.
I prefer collaborative rather than competitive learning.
Tuition cost will determine which university I attend.
I enjoy exploring new places independently.
I want a campus with active student organizations.
I am concerned about graduating with debt.
I need to be within driving distance of home.
I thrive when surrounded by like-minded peers.
I expect my family to help pay for university.
I am willing to study abroad for part of my degree.
I prefer a campus with a strong sense of tradition.
I am looking for the most affordable quality education.
I prefer smaller towns over large cities.
I want a university known for its social life.
I am applying for merit-based scholarships.
I see distance from home as an adventure, not a challenge.
I prefer intimate, close-knit campus communities.
I will choose a less prestigious school if it costs less.
I am open to relocating permanently after university.
I want a campus with strong support services for students.
I plan to live at home to save money.
I am excited about meeting people from different backgrounds.
I prefer a balance between academic rigor and social life.
I will work multiple jobs if needed to afford university.
I am drawn to universities in specific geographic regions.
